definition:
If $f : {\mathbb{C}} \rightarrow {\mathbb{C}}$ is a quasiconformal
mapping with maximal dilatation of $K$, then $f(S^1)$ is called a
[*quasicircle*]{} or $K$-quasicircle.

If $f : {\mathbb{R}}^n \rightarrow {\mathbb{R}}^n$, for $n > 2$ is a
quasiconformal mapping with maximal dilatation $K$, then we call
$f(S^{n-1})$ a [*quasisphere*]{} or $K$-quasisphere.

An example of a quasicircle is the famous Koch snowflake.
